name: K2-288 B
scenarioDescription:
The K2-288 B Exoplanetary System


Overview

K2-288 B is a star with 0.33 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.32 times its radius. It is located 214.35 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 1 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

K2-288 B is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the K2-288 B system


K2-288 B b

K2-288 B b was discovered by the K2 observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.16 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The radius of K2-288 B b is 1.9 that of Earth.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system K2-288 B, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by K2.
